article_title: Crossing the Aisle Hasn’t Advanced the GOP
article_text: Ever the Keynesian, Alan Blinder has forgotten, or never learned, that the $700 billion stimulus package early in Barack Obama’s first term accomplished nothing other than ballooning debt and not holding unemployment under 8% as it was supposed to do. Yet Mr. Blinder says that more stimulus is “welcome” (“A Glimpse of What Bipartisan Compromise Looks Like,” op-ed, Dec. 31). Zero-percent rates, also a stimulus, haven’t spurred strong economic and employment growth. Further, his definition of compromise is very curious. President Obama is the least compromising president in memory. And where was the compromise by the...
